body:
@fogfish could you share your full config file?

also, if possible, the goreleaser output log.

---

if not, a couple of questions:

- how many builds in your `build` section?
- how many archives? are they all with format `binary`?
- do you have a custom `brews.install`, maybe?
- in the logs, please look for warns like "guessing install to be XYZ"

---

in any case, thanks for reporting and for the extra info!

Nothing special has been done for the config. It is really out-of-the-box file generated by goreleaser:
https://github.com/assay-it/assay-it/blob/v1.0.4/.goreleaser.yaml#L5
https://github.com/assay-it/assay-it/releases/tag/v1.0.4

and outbound tap
https://github.com/assay-it/homebrew-tap/blob/ade7afb2faba430bb2712fc1681cc51f60643cb9/Formula/assay-it.rb

No errors by goreleaser, everything work fine. Just to empathize again, it seems that the binary "archives" cannot be handler by `bin.install` because the name of downloaded file is not matching expectation.

okay, you actually probably just need to remove this line:

https://github.com/assay-it/assay-it/blob/bbded6cb5eb926f979a7ce61c92e373aa305c74a/.goreleaser.yaml#L43

goreleaser will then guess the correct install, hopefully. 

You can try it out with `goreleaser --clean --snapshot`, and investigating the `dist/*.rb` file.

Excellent! Thank you a lot for support! It has fixed it. 

```
def install
  bin.install "assay-it_1.0.7-next_darwin_amd64" => "assay-it"
end
```
